snippet: Allyson Felix and Jeneba Tarmoh had said they would wait until the Olympic 200-meter team was chosen before deciding how to break their tie in the 100.
abstract: Sprinter Allyson Felix wins 200-meter final at the United States Olympic track and field trials in 21.69 seconds, a personal best and the third fastest time by an American woman; result could help resolve the dead heat between Felix and Jeneba Tarmoh in the 100 meters.

byline.original: By KEN BELSON and MARY PILON

lead_paragraph: Allyson Felix and Jeneba Tarmoh had said they would wait until the Olympic 200-meter team was chosen before deciding how to break their tie in the 100.

headline.seo: U.S. Olympic Track Trials — Felix Wins 200 Meters With Ease
headline.main: Felix’s 200-Meter Win May Help Settle the 100
headline.print_headline: Felix’s 200-Meter Win May Help Settle the 100
